greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest nontrivial extension of n^2 which is a square.
comment: Nontrivial extension means appending at least one digit even if the number is already a square.
link: M. F. Hasler, Truncated squares, OEIS wiki, Jan 16 2012
Index to sequences related to truncating digits of squares.
xref: See also A023110 = A031149^2 and A202303 = A031150^2 for a related concept, and cross-references there (and in links) for the analog in bases other than 10. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 28 2014
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_
